summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 discussing the U.S. Virgin Islands (USVI) Attorney General's civil RICO lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein's estate. Attorney Russell Pate, who worked on the complaint, emails numerous victim attorneys to coordinate strategies and praises the USVI AG's actions. The chain includes internal forwarding among legal professionals.

events.title: USVI Files Civil RICO Lawsuit
events.description: The U.S. Virgin Islands Attorney General files a civil RICO lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein's estate.

events.title: Proposed Sailing Charter
events.description: Russell Pate mentions a pre-paid sailing catamaran charter through the British Virgin Islands to Anegada, offering an extra cabin to colleagues.

keyFacts: The U.S. Virgin Islands Attorney General filed a civil RICO lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein's estate on or around January 15, 2020.
Attorney Russell Pate claims to have worked as private counsel on the USVI's complaint for the four months prior to its filing.
Pate's email aims to coordinate legal strategies and potential joint mediations among the numerous attorneys representing Epstein's victims.
The USVI Attorney General is described as being 'very concerned about assisting/helping the victims' and willing to have investigators speak to victims trafficked to the islands.
Pate asserts there are 'more than enough assets for all claimants' against the Epstein estate and doubts a Virgin Islands jury would 'leav[e] a penny to the Estate.'
